intro: Palicourea berteroana, commonly known as the "Coca of the Andes," is a climbing shrub native to South America, particularly in the Andean regions of Peru and Ecuador. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many plants with medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that appear in clusters. Its fruits are small, red berries that contain seeds, and the plant is often found in humid, shaded environments. Palicourea berteroana has been traditionally used in Andean cultures for its purported medicinal benefits.
